text: The 2018 California gubernatorial election was held on November 6, 2018, to elect the governor of California. Then-incumbent Lieutenant Governor Gavin Newsom was elected the next governor of California. == Background == In February 2015, while Gavin Newsom was lieutenant governor, he announced he would run for governor in 2018, to succeed term limited governor Jerry Brown. In mid-2017, businessman John H. Cox announced his candidacy for governor in 2018. After previously running for public office many times. == Election results == On November 6. 2018, Lieutenant Governor Gavin Newsom defeated republican candidate and businessman John H. Cox, in a wide and large margin. == Inauguration == Newsom became the 40th governor of California on January 7, 2019. ==References== Category:California gubernatorial elections Category:November 2018 events Category:2018 California elections
title: 2018 California gubernatorial election
